data.sentence: The word عَنْكَ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: he put it or laid it in/on a place, put it or threw it down from his hand, opposite of Ra-Fa-Ayn, put down a thing, brought forth, to appoint, to impose/remit, give over, relinquish, lowered his grade/rank/condition, suffer loss, did not gain in it, lowered/humbled, depository, the proper place of a thing.
data.sentence: The word وَوَضَعْنَا comes from the root و ض ع and is associated with the meanings: he put it or laid it in/on a place, put it or threw it down from his hand, opposite of Ra-Fa-Ayn, put down a thing, brought forth, to appoint, to impose/remit, give over, relinquish, lowered his grade/rank/condition, suffer loss, did not gain in it, lowered/humbled, depository, the proper place of a thing.

data.meanings: to carry a burden, bear a load, perpetrate (a crime)
data.sentence: The word وِزْرَكَ comes from the root و ز ر and is associated with the meanings: to carry a burden, bear a load, perpetrate (a crime)
